data.name: AgreeItem1
data.value: A lawyer is helping you for free.

data.name: AgreeItem2
data.value: The lawyer only helps you with the question you type into this website. The lawyer won’t help you after that or do anything else for you.

data.name: AgreeItem3
data.value: This means:

data.name: AgreeItem3Sub1
data.value: The lawyer won't write letters, make calls, or file papers for you.

data.name: AgreeItem3Sub2
data.value: The lawyer won't go to meetings or court for you.

data.name: AgreeItem3Sub3
data.value: You can't contact the lawyer outside of this website unless the lawyer gives you permission.

data.name: AgreeItem3Sub4
data.value: If the lawyer asks you to send documents, and gives you contact information for you to be able to do that, you agree not to use that information to contact the lawyer for other help unless the lawyer gives you permission to do that.

data.name: AgreeItem4
data.value: The lawyer has a {{StateName}} law license.

data.name: AgreeItem5
data.value: The lawyer only tells you {{StateName}} law. Laws may be different in other states.

data.name: AgreeItem6
data.value: All volunteer lawyers using the system can see what you ask in your question.

data.name: AgreeItem7
data.value: nly the lawyer who helps you can see your name, county, and the other side's name in the case. If you have an open legal case, the lawyer who helps you can see what county you entered for that case.

data.name: AgreeItem8
data.value: The people who run this website do not provide the legal advice.

data.name: AgreeItem9
data.value: The people who run this website are not responsible for the advice the volunteer lawyer gives you through this website.

data.name: AgreeWarning
data.value: If you don’t agree, then you can't use this website.

data.name: IAgree
data.value: I agree

data.name: IDontAgree
data.value: I don't agree

data.name: InfoAgreeItem1
data.value: what type of legal problem you had (housing, family law, debt, immigration, etc.),

data.name: InfoAgreeItem10
data.value: how you found our website (from a Google search, from washingtonlawhelp.org, or from another organization)

data.name: InfoAgreeItem11
data.value: If you communicate with the lawyer outside of the website, the people running this website can’t see what the lawyer tells you and won’t keep records of this.

data.name: InfoAgreeItem12
data.value: The people running this website are not responsible for the advice the lawyer tells you outside of the website.

data.name: InfoAgreeItem2
data.value: your question

data.name: InfoAgreeItem3
data.value: the name of the lawyer who answered your question,

data.name: InfoAgreeItem4
data.value: what the lawyer told you on the website,

data.name: InfoAgreeItem5
data.value: your responses to what the lawyer told you,

data.name: InfoAgreeItem6
data.value: what county you live in,

data.name: InfoAgreeItem7
data.value: the other party’s name in your case (if you entered this information)

data.name: InfoAgreeItem8
data.value: the county your case is in (if you entered this information)

data.name: InfoAgreeItem9
data.value: what you clicked on in the website (where you went on this website), and

data.name: InfoUnderstandAndAgree
data.value: This is the information the website keeps:

data.name: LawyerAgreeItem1
data.value: The lawyer or the lawyer's company could be helping the other person in your case and not know that when they answer your question.

data.name: LawyerAgreeItem2
data.value: If the lawyer or lawyer's company is helping the other person in your case and they answer your question, they are not breaking the law because they did not know it was the same case. If you use this website, it means you will not blame the lawyer or the lawyer's company for not knowing it was the same case.

data.name: LawyerAgreeItem3
data.value: If the lawyer finds out they are helping both sides on the same case before they answer your question, they can't answer your question. They have to give your question to another lawyer on the website who is not already working on the case.

data.name: LawyerUnderstandAndAgree
data.value: Lawyers can only help one side in a case. For example, a lawyer can help either the renter or the landlord. The lawyer can’t help both of them with the same case. If you use this website, it means you understand and agree that:

data.name: SecretAgreeItem1
data.value: Only the people who run the website, you, and the volunteer lawyers can see the question and the facts you type into the website.

data.name: SecretAgreeItem2
data.value: Only the people who run the website and the lawyer who agrees to answer your question can see your name.

data.name: SecretAgreeItem3
data.value: This website keeps your information to help make the website better.

data.name: SecretAgreeItem4
data.value: We won't sell your information. We won't share it unless a judge says we have to. We can't promise no one will break into the website and see your information.

data.name: SecretUnderstandAndAgree
data.value: Your questions are secret.

data.name: Title
data.value: User Agreement

data.name: UnderstandAndAgree
data.value: If you use this website, it means you understand and agree that:

data.name: UseAgreeItem1
data.value: I do not already have a lawyer helping me with this problem.

data.name: UseAgreeItem2
data.value: I will tell the truth about my legal problem.

data.name: UseUnderstandAndAgree
data.value: To use this website, you must also agree to the next two statements:
